content.question: What is the rotational inertia of the door if it is instead rotated about an axis that runs vertically through its center, as shown in Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="one twelfth m, times w squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>12</mn></mfrac><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>w</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="one sixth m, times w squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>6</mn></mfrac><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>w</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="one fourth m, times w squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>w</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="one third m, times w squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>w</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="one twelfth m, times w squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>12</mn></mfrac><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>w</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
